intro: Vincetoxicum floridanum, commonly known as Florida celandine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
